Title: To Each His Own
Cast: Olivia de Havilland, Mary Anderson, Roland Culver, Phillip Terry, Bill Goodwin, Virginia Welles, Victoria Horne, Griff Barnett, Alma Macrorie, Billy Ward, Frank Faylen, Willard Robertson, Arthur Loft, Virginia Farmer, Doris Lloyd
Plot: An unwed mother, forced to give up her child to avoid scandal, follows her son's life from afar even as she prospers in business. During World War I, small-town girl Josephine Norris has an illegitimate son by an itinerant pilot. After a scheme to adopt him ends up giving him to another family, she devotes her life to loving him from afar. Written by Mark Foltz <foltz@triton.wustl.edu>
Keywords: adopted son, cosmetics, small town, unwed mother, pilot
Location: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Olivia de Havilland, John Lund, Mary Anderson
Writer: Charles Brackett (screenplay), Jacques Théry (screenplay) (as Jacques Thery) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by Mitchell Leisen.  With Olivia de Havilland, John Lund, Mary Anderson, Roland Culver. An unwed mother, forced to give up her child to avoid scandal, follows her son's life from afar even as she prospers in business.
